## `r title` {.tabset}

### Distribution
```{r, fig.height=6, fig.cap = distribution_caption}
# TODO: do the cutting programatically (use plotly?)
if(!is_categorical) {
  df <- meta_data %>%
    mutate(
      # TODO: Grab just the max number for display (and format if needed)
      bin = cut_interval(
        !!as.name(meta_var),
        n = 30,
      ),
      timeframe = ifelse(
        year == params$year,
        year,
        paste0("Pre-", params$year)
      )
    ) %>%
    group_by(timeframe, bin) %>%
  arrange(!!meta_var) %>%
  summarise(
    count = n(),
    books = paste(
      paste0(book, " (", !!as.name(meta_var), ")"),
      collapse = "<br>"
    )
  )
} else {
  df <- meta_data %>%
    mutate(
      bin = !!as.name(meta_var),
      timeframe = ifelse(
        year == params$year,
        year,
        paste0("Pre-", params$year)
      )
    ) %>%
  group_by(timeframe, bin) %>%
  arrange(!!meta_var) %>%
  summarise(
    count = n(),
    books = paste(book, collapse = "<br>")
  )
}

 df %>%
  plot_ly(alpha = 0.6) %>%
  add_bars(
    hovertext = ~books,
    color = ~timeframe,
    x = ~bin,
    y = ~count,
    hovertemplate = paste(
      "<b>%{y} Book(s):</b>",
      "%{hovertext}<extra></extra>",
      sep = "<br>"
    )
  ) %>%
  layout(
    barmode = "stack",
    bargap = 0,
    xaxis = list(title = list(text = "")),
    yaxis = list(title = list(text = ""))
  )
```
